channel.title: Nature Topological Phononic Multi-Discipline RSS
channel.description: Latest topological and phononic articles from Nature across chemistry, engineering, materials-science, nanoscience-and-technology, optics-and-photonics, physics (first 3 pages per subject, 2023-2025, research and reviews)

item.title: Multi objective optimization algorithm for hybrid quantum harmonic oscillator and its application in rotor system optimization
item.description: No summary

item.title: Interplay between multipolar order and multipole-induced superconductivity in PrTi2Al20
item.description: The rare-earth superconductor PrTr2Al20 (Tr = Ti, V) possesses quadrupolar and octupolar but no magnetic dipolar moments. Here, the authors suggest an intimate link between the quadrupolar order parameter and the superconducting pairing in this material.

item.title: Asymmetrical estimator for training encapsulated deep photonic neural networks
item.description: Training photonic neural networks is often a challenging process due to the non-ideal device behaviours. Here, the authors introduce the asymmetrical training method as a lightweight and efficient alternative for promoting photonic acceleration in wider application scenarios.

item.title: Energy storages on the ferroelectric microstructures with transformation and nano vortex pattern
item.description: No summary

item.title: Robust non-Abelian even-denominator fractional Chern insulator in twisted bilayer MoTe2
item.description: Recent experiments suggest the possibility of realizing fractional Chern insulators in twisted transition metal dichalcogenides. Here, the authors present numerics revealing a robust non-Abelian zero magnetic-field state that may be realized in twisted bilayer MoTe2 in a specific parameter range.

item.title: Multimodal trajectory prediction for intelligent connected vehicles in complex road scenarios based on causal reasoning and driving cognition characteristics
item.description: No summary

item.title: In silico exploration of novel EGFR-targeting compounds: integrative molecular modeling, docking, pharmacokinetics, and MD simulations for advancing anti-cervical cancer therapeutics
item.description: No summary

item.title: Research on blasting damage to tunnel surrounding rock based on acoustic full waveform signal analysis
item.description: No summary

item.title: Unconventional gapping behaviour in a kagome superconductor
item.description: The pairing mechanism in kagome superconductors is still not fully understood. Now, CsV3Sb5, which belongs to this family, is shown to have orbital-selective pairing with two distinct superconducting domes that are not separated by any phase boundary.

item.title: Impact of barrier width on topological insulator phase in InN/InGaN quantum wells with moderate strain
item.description: No summary

item.title: Integrated optical entangled quantum vortex emitters
item.description: Combining on-chip photon-pair sources, two sets of linear integrated circuits for path entanglements and two path-to-orbital angular momentum converters, free-space-entangled orbital angular momentum photon pairs can be generated in high-dimensional vortex states, offering a high level of programmable dynamical reconfigurability.

item.title: Signatures of Floquet electronic steady states in graphene under continuous-wave mid-infrared irradiation
item.description: Previous investigations of Floquet states in solid state samples have been mostly based on ultrafast light excitations. Here, the authors report evidence of non-equilibrium steady states in graphene under continuous-wave mid-infrared irradiation, consistent with a long-lived Floquet phase physical picture.

item.title: Realization of a one-dimensional topological insulator in ultrathin germanene nanoribbons
item.description: Although 2D topological insulators have been experimentally realized, their 1D counterparts remain difficult to investigate. Here, the authors report the observation of 0D topological states localized at the ends of the zigzag-terminated germanene nanoribbons with a width below ∼2 nm, indicating the emergence of a 1D topological insulator.

item.title: Ephemeral superconductivity atop the false vacuum
item.description: The authors theoretically study superconductors that are terminated by a first-order phase transition to a correlated phase of different symmetry, referred to as the false vacuum. They propose that quenching across this transition leads to a nonequilibrium ephemeral superconductor, detectable with simple transport probes.

item.title: Predicting the spatial demand for public charging stations for EVs using multi-source big data: an example from jinan city, china
item.description: No summary

item.title: Synthesis of high quality two dimensional covalent organic frameworks through a self-sacrificing guest strategy
item.description: The quality of covalent organic frameworks is often compromised by structural damages induced during their activation procedure which influences their subsequent applications. Here, the authors describe a self-sacrificing guest strategy to synthesize high-quality two-dimensional COFs by incorporating salt guests within the pores of the COF structure.

item.title: Advancing nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations in solids with E(3) equivariant deep neural hamiltonians
item.description: Accurate nonadiabatic molecular dynamics (NAMD) is crucial for studying excited-state dynamics in solids but is computationally expensive. Here, authors use machine learning to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of NAMD simulations in solids.

item.title: Theoretical monitoring of aromaticity induction from noble gases to Borole structure
item.description: No summary

item.title: A travelling-wave strategy for plant–fungal trade
item.description: Symbiotic fungi control network-level structure and flows to meet trade demands.

item.title: Spectroscopy of the fractal Hofstadter energy spectrum
item.description: High-resolution STM/STS visualizes the fractionalization of flat moiré bands into discrete Hofstadter subbands in moiré graphene near the predicted second magic angle, and experimentally establishes several fundamental properties of the fractal Hofstadter energy spectrum.

item.title: Calibrating quantum gates up to 52 qubits in a superconducting processor
item.description: No summary

item.title: Interplay of geometrical and spin chiralities in 3D twisted magnetic ribbons
item.description: The interplay between geometrical and spin chiralities in three-dimensional twisted magnetic ribbons can lead to new functionalities that could allow for innovative chiral spintronics.

item.title: Magneto-ionic vortices: voltage-reconfigurable swirling-spin analog-memory nanomagnets
item.description: Magneto-ionics are a promising approach for controlling magnetism via electric fields, but most studies have been limited to thin films, rather than the nanostructures that would form the basis of a magneto-ionic memory unit. Here, Spasojevic et al demonstrate magneto-ionic control over transitions among paramagnetic, single domain, and vortex states in an array of nanodots.

item.title: Correlated states controlled by a tunable van Hove singularity in moiré WSe2 bilayers
item.description: Twisted transition metal dichalcogenide bilayers exhibit several emerging physical properties, but the connection to the underlying band structure singularities remains difficult to determine experimentally. Here, the authors characterize the influence of an electrically tunable van Hove singularity in twisted bilayer WSe2 on its ferromagnetic and topological phases.

item.title: Topological interactions drive the first fate decision in the Drosophila embryo
item.description: Early positioning of the embryo nuclei is not well understood. Now, experiments show that the orientation of the mitotic spindle is controlled by topological interactions, which determine whether the nucleus remains inside the Drosophila embryo.

item.title: Higher-order Laplacian renormalization
item.description: The renormalization group is a powerful tool to study the universal properties of physical systems. A diffusion-based renormalization scheme now enables the study of scale invariance and universality in higher-order complex networks.

item.title: Generation of three-dimensional cluster entangled state
item.description: Cluster states with three-dimensional connectivities are realized by selecting specific time–frequency mode bases for multimode quantum light. The cluster state generation is verified by nullifier measurements as well as full inseparability tests across all possible bipartitions.

item.title: Evaluating the slope behavior for geophysical flow prediction with advanced machine learning combinations
item.description: No summary

item.title: Orthogonal photopatterning of two-dimensional percolated network films for wafer-scale heterostructures
item.description: A photoreactive crosslinker can be used to directly pattern thin films of exfoliated two-dimensional flakes, and the technique can be performed sequentially to create patterned van der Waals heterostructures at wafer scales.

item.title: Synthesis and application of diazenyl sulfonamide-based schiff bases as potential BRCA2 active inhibitors against MCF-7 breast cancer cell line
item.description: No summary

item.title: Transport and thermoelectric properties of bernal stacked bilayer graphene due to lattice vibrations and magnetic field
item.description: No summary

item.title: Thermal biasing for lattice symmetry breaking and topological edge state imaging
item.description: Thermal biasing can break the lattice symmetry of twisted bilayer graphene, allowing high resolution thermoelectric imaging of its topological edge states above room temperature without applying strong electric or magnetic fields to the system.

item.title: Polymorphic relaxor phase and defect dipole polarization co-reinforced capacitor energy storage in temperature-monitorable high-entropy ferroelectrics
item.description: The authors construct a nanostructure consisting of defect dipole polarization and polymorphic relaxor phases. The high-entropy ceramic achieves an energy density of 11.23 J cm−3, an efficiency of 90.87%, along with temperature sensing feature.

item.title: Low lying excited states quantum entanglement and continuous quantum phase transitions
item.description: No summary

item.title: Generalized angle–orbital angular momentum Talbot effect and modulo mode sorting
item.description: The generalized self-imaging, or generalized Talbot, effect is demonstrated in the azimuthal angle and orbital angular momentum (OAM) domains, providing both a universal strategy for fully arbitrary control of the angular petal numbers or OAM mode spacing and a general method for the realization of efficient OAM mode sorters.

item.title: Magnetic Bloch states at integer flux quanta induced by super-moiré potential in graphene aligned with twisted boron nitride
item.description: Twisted van der Waals structures have shown many emerging physical properties, but uniform moiré wavelengths are usually < 50 nm due to structural relaxation. Here, the authors report the fabrication of super-moiré structures based on graphene/twisted boron nitride, showing a homogeneous moiré wavelength up to 63.2 nm resulting in Brown-Zak oscillations at integer magnetic flux quanta.

item.title: Engineering anisotropic electrodynamics at the graphene/CrSBr interface
item.description: The authors demonstrate a graphene/CrSBr heterostructure exhibiting anisotropic surface plasmon polariton (SPP) propagation in the mid-infrared and terahertz range. Charge transfer at the interface directs SPPs along the quasi-1D chains that compose each CrSBr layer, with propagation lengths varying by an order of magnitude between the two in-plane crystallographic axes.

item.title: Graphene rolls with tunable chirality
item.description: A wax-aided immersion methodology is developed to yield graphene rolls with tunable chiral angles; these graphene rolls exhibit promising chiral electronic properties beyond those of other carbon allotropes.

item.title: Adaptive evolution and early diversification of photonic nanomaterials in marine diatoms
item.description: No summary

item.title: Characterization and potential usage of selected eggshell species
item.description: No summary

item.title: Current induced electromechanical strain in thin antipolar Ag2Se semiconductor
item.description: By an alteration of dipoles and a phase transition, the authors find a giant electromechanical strain triggered by the electric current in thin antipolar Ag2Se semiconductor. The strain has inherent flexibility and conductivity.

item.title: Topologically cloaked magnetic colloidal transport
item.description: Cloaking is a technique for rendering obstacles undetectable, previously applied to waves and now extended to particles. Here using a time-periodic magnetic field, authors report that paramagnetic colloidal particles are guided around cloaked regions in a deformed magnetic lattice, resuming motion as if the distortion were nonexistent.

item.title: Side dominance and eye patches obscuring half of the visual field do not affect walking kinematics
item.description: No summary

item.title: Moiré two-dimensional covalent organic framework superlattices
item.description: On-surface synthesis of two-dimensional polymers is a useful strategy for designing the lattice, orbital and spin symmetries of materials, but controlling their layer stacking remains challenging. Now, a method to synthesize bilayer two-dimensional covalent organic frameworks at a liquid–substrate interface through monomer condensation has been developed; large-area moiré superlattices emerge from the twisted bilayer stacking.

item.title: Global modules robustly emerge from local interactions and smooth gradients
item.description: The principle of peak selection is described, by which local interactions and smooth gradients drive self-organization of discrete global modules.

item.title: Parafermions in moiré minibands
item.description: Parafermions hold promise as building blocks for topological quantum computers but have remained experimentally elusive. Here, the authors employ numerical calculations to demonstrate that parafermion excitations can emerge in partially filled moiré minibands of twisted multilayer graphene systems.

item.title: Interferometric single-shot parity measurement in InAs–Al hybrid devices
item.description: A device architecture based on indium arsenide–aluminium heterostructures with a gate-defined superconducting nanowire allows single-shot interferometric measurement of fermion parity and demonstrates an assignment error probability of 1%.

item.title: Topology shapes dynamics of higher-order networks
item.description: Higher-order interactions reveal new aspects of the interplay between topology and dynamics in complex systems. This Perspective describes the emerging field of higher-order topological dynamics and discusses the open research questions in the area.

item.title: Controlling Coulomb correlations and fine structure of quasi-one-dimensional excitons by magnetic order
item.description: The antiferromagnetic-to-paramagnetic phase transition in a two-dimensional semiconducting magnet, CrSBr, induces an exciton confinement transition from a strongly bound quasi-one-dimensional state to a weakly bound interlayer-delocalized state.

item.title: Discovering chemistry to creep rupture equations in Alloy 617 with machine learning
item.description: No summary

item.title: Massive Dirac magnons in the three-dimensional honeycomb magnetic oxide \(\hbox {FeTiO}_3\)
item.description: No summary

item.title: Topological transition on a conformal manifold for the quantum Ising model with a longer range interaction
item.description: No summary

item.title: Towards the quantized anomalous Hall effect in AlOx-capped MnBi2Te4
item.description: The challenges in reliably reproducing the quantum anomalous Hall effect have emerged as a major bottleneck for MnBi2Te4. Here, the authors develop a fabrication method to address this, paving the way for the fabrication of high-quality dissipationless topological transport devices.

item.title: Dynamic analysis of a novel 3D chaotic map with two internal frequencies
item.description: No summary

item.title: IR thermography & NN models for damaged component thickness detection
item.description: No summary

item.title: Theory of correlated insulators and superconductor at ν = 1 in twisted WSe2
item.description: Recently, superconductivity intertwined with an insulating phase at a commensurate band-filling was discovered in twisted bilayer WSe2. Here, the authors theoretically propose that the observed insulating state may be a quantum spin-liquid Mott insulator with electron fractionalization, separated from the superconductor via a quantum phase transition.

item.title: Compact and reciprocal probe-signal-integrated rotational Doppler velocimetry with fiber-sculpted light
item.description: No summary

item.title: Adaptative two-phase thermal circulation system for complex-shaped electronic device cooling
item.description: Thermal management in compact electrical devices is challenging due to limited space and complex geometries. Here, the authors present a flexible heat pipe that conforms to arbitrary shapes without space constraints, achieving an ultra-high thermal conductivity of 11,363 W/m·K.

item.title: Coulomb interactions and migrating Dirac cones imaged by local quantum oscillations in twisted graphene
item.description: Our understanding of the phase diagram of twisted graphene structures is incomplete. Now, twisted trilayer graphene is examined using a technique that locally images quantum oscillations and shows that a nematic semimetal is favoured at low density.

item.title: Coarse-graining network flow through statistical physics and machine learning
item.description: Information dynamics are key in complex systems. The authors apply graph neural networks to group components for coarse-graining networks, reducing computational complexity. Their approach preserves information flow under compression, being effective for large networks.

item.title: Highly porous metal-organic framework glass design and application for gas separation membranes
item.description: Here authors demonstrate a strategy of enhancing the porosity of MOF glasses through topological engineering. Unlike the production of inorganic porous glasses by leaching, the pore structures in MOF glasses were controlled by using a highly porous topology of the crystalline precursor.

item.title: Solvent-free fabrication of ultrathin two-dimensional metal oxides/sulfides in a fixed interlayer by geometric confinement
item.description: The pursuit of a versatile and efficient method to precisely tailor ultrathin 2D frameworks remains challenge. Herein, a series of ultrathin 2D metal oxide and sulfides with the thickness of ~1 nm were created through a confined interlayer growth strategy in combination with melt infiltration.

item.title: On computing extended graph energies and their thermodynamic properties for benzenoid hydrocarbons
item.description: No summary

item.title: A dynamic cobweb resistance network solution based on a structured zeroing neural network and its applications
item.description: No summary

item.title: The influence of frequency and temperature on the AC-conductivity in \(\text {TlInTe}_2\) semiconductor single crystal
item.description: No summary

item.title: Fully addressable designer superstructures assembled from one single modular DNA origami
item.description: Methods for creating large DNA assemblies with low cost and enhanced structural control are of interest. Here, the authors report moDON (modular DNA origami nanostructure) that combines two approaches to modularity resulting in tens of thousands of different monomers and superstructures, constructed at biological time scales and minimal cost.

item.title: Holographic tomographic volumetric additive manufacturing
item.description: The authors demonstrate a holographic light engine enabling volumetric 3D printing with high precision and flexibility. Enhanced light projection efficiency and speckle noise mitigation enable rapid fabrication of millimetric objects, including soft cell-laden hydrogels, with 31 µm resolution.

item.title: Spin-dependent thermoelectric properties of a hybrid ferromagnetic metal/quantum dot/topological insulator junction
item.description: No summary

item.title: Polarization-controlled chiral transport
item.description: No summary

item.title: Frontier molecular orbital weighted model based networks for revealing organic delayed fluorescence efficiency
item.description: An electronic structure-infused deep-learning neural network based on frontier molecular orbitals representation is constructed to predict the emission efficiencies of thermally activated delayed fluorescence (TADF) emitters.

item.title: A quantum dot in germanium proximitized by a superconductor
item.description: The authors achieve gate-controlled proximitization of a quantum dot in a planar germanium heterostructure, an isotopically purifiable group IV material. A patterned Pt germanosilicide superconductor is introduced via a thermally activated reaction.

item.title: Concrete crack detection using ridgelet neural network optimized by advanced human evolutionary optimization
item.description: No summary

item.title: A primary quantum current standard based on the Josephson and the quantum Hall effects
item.description: Realizing the ampere, the unit of electrical current, involves controlling a flow of elementary charges with high accuracy. Here, the authors present the generation of sizeable currents at quantized values with relative uncertainties below 10−8.

item.title: Stepwise amplification of circularly polarized luminescence in indium-based metal halides by regulating their structural dimension
item.description: Designing efficient circularly polarized light sources requires a balance between the photoluminescence quantum yield and the luminescence dissymmetry factor. Here, the authors develop indium-based chiral metal halides with efficient CPL characteristics by modulating their structural dimensions.

item.title: Observation of anti-PT-symmetry and higher-order exceptional point PT-symmetry in ternary systems for single-mode operation
item.description: No summary

item.title: Modeling and estimation of physiochemical properties of cancer drugs using entropy measures
item.description: No summary

item.title: Three-dimensional mapping of the altermagnetic spin splitting in CrSb
item.description: Altermagnets combine the rapid dynamics and zero magnetization of collinear antiferromagnets with the spin-splitting of ferromagnets, making them an idea platform for both fundamental research and applications. Here, Yang, Li and coauthors map the large altermagnetic spin-splitting in CrSb located near the Fermi level.

item.title: Observation of anomalously large Nernst effects in conducting polymers
item.description: The Nernst effect of transverse thermoelectric flow is usually small in less ordered systems with low charge mobility. Here, the authors show that conjugated polymers defy this expectation with Nernst effects orders of magnitude larger than predicted.

item.title: Room-temperature anisotropic in-plane spin dynamics in graphene induced by PdSe2 proximity
item.description: Pentagonal PdSe2 induces anisotropic, gate-tunable spin–orbit coupling in graphene, enabling a tenfold modulation of in-plane spin lifetimes at room temperature and providing opportunities to control spin dynamics in van der Waals materials.

item.title: Topology controls flow patterns in active double emulsions
item.description: Active emulsions and liquid crystalline shells offer a unique framework for exploring topological matter due to their complex morphologies and dynamic properties. Here the authors report how activity generates diverse nonequilibrium states, from defect-free motile states to complex topologically active configurations, providing insights into controlled flow and topology in active systems.

item.title: Electro-optic cavities for in-situ measurement of cavity fields
item.description: We design, implement, and model electro-optic cavities (EOCs) to unlock time-domain measurements of intra-cavity fields. Furthermore, we decode avoided crossings in continuously tunable EOCs, enabling switchable light-matter coupling in the future.

item.title: Efficiently regulating the electrochromic behavior of naphthalene-diimide-based zirconium-organic frameworks through linker installation
item.description: Redox-active MOFs have demonstrated advantages in the field of electrochromism but controlling and modulating the electrochromic behaviors in specific MOFs remains a challenge. Here, the authors design a redox-active Zr-MOF with coordination unsaturated pockets which exhibits reversible electrochromic behavior.

item.title: Quadrupolar excitons in MoSe2 bilayers
item.description: Quadrupolar excitons — a superposition of two dipolar excitons with anti-aligned dipole moments — are of great interest for applications in quantum simulations and for the investigation of many-body physics. Here, the authors demonstrate the emergence of quadrupolar excitons in natural MoSe2 homobilayers, whose energy shifts quadratically in electric field.

item.title: Demonstration of two qubit entangling gates in a 2D ring resonator based coupler architecture
item.description: No summary

item.title: Thermalization and criticality on an analogue–digital quantum simulator
item.description: A hybrid analogue–digital quantum simulator is used to demonstrate beyond-classical performance in benchmarking experiments and to study thermalization phenomena in an XY quantum magnet, including the breakdown of Kibble–Zurek scaling predictions and signatures of the Kosterlitz–Thouless phase transition.

item.title: Flat-band enhanced antiferromagnetic fluctuations and superconductivity in pressurized CsCr3Sb5
item.description: The authors theoretically investigate the spin fluctuations and superconducting instabilities in the kagome phase of CsCr3Sb5 under high pressure. They find that incipient flat bands play a role in enhancing antiferromagnetic fluctuations, which in turn mediate the competing s-wave and d-wave superconducting ordering.

item.title: Short and long-range magnetic ordering and emergent topological transition in (Mn1−xNix)2P2S6
item.description: No summary

item.title: Topological water-wave structures manipulating particles
item.description: Interfering water waves can be tailored to realize topological structures, namely wave vortices, skyrmions and polarization Möbius strips, that can be used to manipulate particles floating on the water surface.

item.title: Deep empirical neural network for optical phase retrieval over a scattering medium
item.description: Tu et al. demonstrate that the unique integration of a convolutional neural network with an empirical model measured for an optical scattering system can unscramble the scattering and see through the opaque medium in an untrained fashion, featured as a deep empirical neural network.

item.title: Superfluid stiffness of magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene
item.description: Research on superconductivity in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene reveals unconventional behaviour, an anisotropic gap and a significant role of quantum geometry, using combined d.c. transport and microwave measurements, suggesting new insights into superconductivity mechanisms.

item.title: Polytype switching by super-lubricant van der Waals cavity arrays
item.description: By etching cavities into a thin lubricant spacer and encapsulating it with functional flakes, electric and mechanical switching of single-crystal, van der Waals stacking configurations is demonstrated.

item.title: A modified energy management strategy for PV/diesel hybrid system to reduce diesel consumption based on artificial protozoa optimizer
item.description: No summary

item.title: Structural edge damage detection based on wavelet transform and immune genetic algorithm
item.description: No summary

item.title: Optimization and modeling of sulfur removal from liquid fuel using carbon-based adsorbents through synergistic application of RSM and machine learning
item.description: No summary

item.title: Maximizing temperature sensitivity in a one-dimensional photonic crystal thermal sensor
item.description: No summary

item.title: Spin-torque-driven gigahertz magnetization dynamics in the non-collinear antiferromagnet Mn3Sn
item.description: An optically induced spin current pulse induces gigahertz magnetization dynamics in Mn3Sn with a spin coherence length of approximately 15 nm, which is longer than in ferromagnets.

item.title: Schizophrenia recognition based on three-dimensional adaptive graph convolutional neural network
item.description: No summary

item.title: Programmable quantum circuits in a large-scale photonic waveguide array
item.description: No summary

item.title: Using computer modeling to find new LRRK2 inhibitors for parkinson’s disease
item.description: No summary

item.title: Studying the impact of chitosan salicylaldehyde/schiff base/CuFe2O4 in PC3 cells via theoretical studies and inhibition of PI3K/AKT/mTOR signalling
item.description: No summary

item.title: A spatiotemporal distribution prediction model for electric vehicles charging load in transportation power coupled network
item.description: No summary

item.title: On QSPR analysis of pulmonary cancer drugs using python-driven topological modeling
item.description: No summary

item.title: Degeneracy-breaking and long-lived multimode microwave electromechanical systems enabled by cubic silicon-carbide membrane crystals
item.description: Coherent electrical manipulation of long-lived, multimode mechanical resonators is crucial for several applications. Here the authors report the integration of a high quality cubic SiC-membrane mechanical resonator with a 3D microwave cavity, enabling long-lived phononic memory and tunable light slowing.

item.title: Transformer-generated atomic embeddings to enhance prediction accuracy of crystal properties with machine learning
item.description: Atomic representations are crucial for building reliable and transferable machine learning models. Here, the authors propose transformer-based universal atomic embeddings to enhance the prediction accuracy of crystal properties.

item.title: Sub-nanometer depth resolution and single dopant visualization achieved by tilt-coupled multislice electron ptychography
item.description: The authors implement a computational strategy that couples electron diffraction datasets from a few small-angle projections to more than triple the depth resolution to sub-nanometers and improve dopant detection in bulk crystals.

item.title: Topological linking determines elasticity in limited valence networks
item.description: Experiments and simulations of DNA nanostar hydrogels reveal that microscopic topology determines macroscale elasticity in amorphous networks.

item.title: GATFELPA integrates graph attention networks and enhanced label propagation for robust community detection
item.description: No summary

item.title: Tailored topotactic chemistry unlocks heterostructures of magnetic intercalation compounds
item.description: Synthesis of heterostructures of magnetic intercalation compounds in transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs) via directed topotactic reactions enables the creation of multi-component magnetic architectures, overcoming limitations of crystallographic incommensurability

item.title: Stable quantum droplets with high-order vorticity in zero-order Bessel lattice
item.description: No summary

item.title: A superconducting nanowire two-photon coincidence counter with combinatorial time logic and amplitude multiplexing
item.description: A superconducting nanowire two-photon coincidence counter is demonstrated with topological optimization of delay-time series. Using a hybrid time–amplitude multiplexing strategy, all 152 potential single- and two-photon events are resolved in a 16-pixel configuration.

item.title: Direct radiation pressure measurements for lightsail membranes
item.description: Simultaneous measurements of the optical force and power exerted by a collimated laser beam on a 50-nm-thick silicon nitride lightsail membrane suspended by compliant micromechanical springs quantify the radiation pressure, enabling further multiphysics studies of radiation pressure forces on macroscopic objects.

item.title: Coherent harmonic generation of magnons in spin textures
item.description: Recently, significant progress has been made in higher harmonic generation of spin waves in magnetic materials, but it remains challenging to probe the coherence. Here, Lan, Liu et al observe the higher-harmonic spin-wave generation induced by static edge spin textures in a soft ferromagnetic film, and probe the coherence of higher harmonic generation.

item.title: Coalescence of multiple topological orders in quasi-one-dimensional bismuth halide chains
item.description: The authors find multiple topological transitions and a composite topological phase by two mutually exclusive topological orders, strong topological order and high-order topological order, in a quasi-1D system.

item.title: Self-rerouting sensor network for electronic skin resilient to severe damage
item.description: Severe damage to electronic skins typically requires extensive sensor arrays to restore communication pathways. Here, the authors present a cost-effective and efficient sensor network architecture that autonomously re-routes signals after damage, enabling rapid data readout with minimal power consumption.

item.title: Time-resolved momentum microscopy with fs-XUV photons at high repetition rates with flexible energy and time resolution
item.description: No summary

item.title: Light-driven dancing of nematic colloids in fractional skyrmions and bimerons
item.description: Skyrmions and fractional skyrmions are promising for spintronics applications but are challenging to create, observe, and manipulate, with a limited understanding of their impact on colloid dynamics. Here authors demonstrate the creation and light-actuated transformation of skyrmion textures in nematic liquid crystals, enabling colloidal assemblies and dynamic behaviors.

item.title: Transition from the topological to the chaotic in the nonlinear Su–Schrieffer–Heeger model
item.description: Nonlinear topological insulators are investigated from the viewpoint of dynamical systems. Strong nonlinearity induces spatially chaotic modes, which break the conventional notion of topology - the bulk-edge correspondence between topological invariants and localized modes.

item.title: Powertrain configuration design for two mode power split hybrid electric vehicle
item.description: No summary

item.title: Re-locative guided search optimized self-sparse attention enabled deep learning decoder for quantum error correction
item.description: No summary

item.title: Comparative study of degree, neighborhood and reverse degree based indices for drugs used in lung cancer treatment through QSPR analysis
item.description: No summary

item.title: The formation of a nuclear-spin dark state in silicon
item.description: Electron qubits in solid-state systems often couple to nuclear spins in the surrounding material, causing decoherence. Now, nuclear spins in silicon have been put into a dark state, which could improve qubit coherence for quantum applications.

item.title: Correlated spin-wave generation and domain-wall oscillation in a topologically textured magnetic film
item.description: A laser-free ultrafast Lorentz electron microscope has been developed, integrating a microwave-based electron pulser to achieve high spatiotemporal imaging of spin-wave dynamics in a topologically textured thin-film permalloy.

item.title: Phonon-limited electronic transport through first principles
item.description: A better understanding of electronic transport in semiconductors is essential for both fundamental and applied physics, as it directly affects key material properties such as the conductivity and thermoelectric quantities. This Technical Review explores different frameworks and computational tools available for computing these properties of semiconductors.

item.title: Cryogenic in-memory computing using magnetic topological insulators
item.description: Material implementation of machine learning algorithms for advanced computing at cryogenic temperature remains rare. Here, the authors report a cryogenic in-memory computing platform using chiral edge states of magnetic topological insulators.

item.title: Thermophysical analysis of time-dependent magnetized Casson hybrid nanofluid flow (Cu + GO/Kerosene Oil) using Darcy-Forchheimer and thermal radiative models for industrial cooling applications
item.description: No summary

item.title: Fast single atom imaging for optical lattice arrays
item.description: High-resolution imaging is essential for quantum simulation and computation in optical lattices and tweezers. Here, authors achieve fast 2.4-microsecond single-atom imaging with 99.4% fidelity and demonstrate number-resolved imaging without parity projection, advancing quantum readout capabilities.

item.title: Thermoelectric properties of a quantum dot attached to normal metal and topological superconductor
item.description: No summary

item.title: Mechanical force-induced interlayer sliding in interfacial ferroelectrics
item.description: Manipulation of controllable polarization evolutions is a big challenge. The authors fabricate the irregular moirés, identifying three distinct types of moiré domains with different patterns, modulating them by external mechanical force disturbing.

item.title: Bearing characteristics and continuous–discontinuous numerical analysis of a pressure grouting pile in a calcareous sand foundation
item.description: No summary

item.title: Triplet-ground-state nonalternant nanographene with high stability and long spin lifetimes
item.description: While high-spin carbon-based polyradicals exhibit significant potential for applications in quantum information storage and sensing, their application is hampered by limited structural diversity and chemical instability. Here, the authors report the synthesis and isolation of a stable nonalternant nanographene with a triplet ground state.

item.title: Time-hidden magnetic order in a multi-orbital Mott insulator
item.description: Searches for metastable states with properties not found in thermal equilibrium have been restricted to either ultrafast or slow timescales. A metastable state in an intermediate time window has now been identified in a photo-doped Mott insulator.

item.title: Direct observation of chiral edge current at zero magnetic field in a magnetic topological insulator
item.description: Quantized edge current is the hallmark of topological phenomena in condensed matter physics. Here, the authors use advanced scanning techniques to image the chiral edge current distribution in the antiferromagnetic topological material MnBi2Te4.

item.title: Droplets impact on sparse microgrooved non-wetting surfaces
item.description: No summary

item.title: Multicooperation of Turtle-inspired amphibious spherical robots
item.description: No summary

item.title: Ion bridging enables high-voltage polyether electrolytes for quasi-solid-state batteries
item.description: The application of polyether electrolytes for Li-ion batteries is limited by their poor oxidative stability. Here, authors report an ion-bridging approach to extend their oxidation potential by stabilizing lone pairs of ethereal oxygen through Zn2+−O coordination.

item.title: Superconductivity in 5.0° twisted bilayer WSe2
item.description: We report superconductivity, in a limited region of displacement field and density, in 5.0° twisted bilayer WSe2 with a maximum critical temperature of 426 mK, establishing that moiré flat-band superconductivity extends beyond graphene structures.

item.title: Local polar order controls mechanical stress and triggers layer formation in Myxococcus xanthus colonies
item.description: The decision to form a fruiting body have been studied extensively, however, the mechanical events that trigger the creation of multiple cell layers is poorly understood. Here the authors find M. xanthus cells adjust their reversal frequency to control mechanical stresses that triggers layer formation in the colonies.

item.title: Extended quantum anomalous Hall states in graphene/hBN moiré superlattices
item.description: New topological states have been observed in rhombohedral graphene/hBN moiré superlattices, including fractional and extended quantum anomalous Hall effects, at ultra-low temperatures, demonstrating the rich quantum phenomena emerging from correlated electrons in topological flat bands.

item.title: Observation of magnetic skyrmion lattice in Cr0.82Mn0.18Ge by small-angle neutron scattering
item.description: No summary

item.title: Moiré-driven topological electronic crystals in twisted graphene
item.description: We report signatures of a generalized version of the anomalous Hall crystal in twisted bilayer–trilayer graphene, whose formation is driven by the moiré potential.

item.title: Probing and manipulating the Mexican hat-shaped valence band of In2Se3
item.description: Inverted Mexican hat valence band is a desirable feature of van der Waal materials as it can yield new phases and functionalities, but it has been observed in only a few materials. Here the authors use experiments and calculations to reveal this feature in the van der Waals ferroelectric semiconductor In2Se3.

item.title: Synthesis of a semimetallic Weyl ferromagnet with point Fermi surface
item.description: Van der Waals (Cr,Bi)2Te3, synthesized by non-equilibrium molecular beam epitaxy, is characterized by magnetotransport measurements and shown to be a semimetallic Weyl ferromagnet, with Fermi surface composed of two Weyl points and no irrelevant electronic states.

item.title: Double-sided van der Waals epitaxy of topological insulators across an atomically thin membrane
item.description: Double-sided epitaxy of van der Waals materials through atomic membranes is demonstrated, enabling electrons to resonantly tunnel between aligned topological insulator surfaces with the conservation of energy, momentum and spin helicity.

item.title: Quasi-static and dynamic compression behavior of stacked pyramidal lattice structures with I-beam struts
item.description: No summary

item.title: Programmable simulations of molecules and materials with reconfigurable quantum processors
item.description: Quantum simulations of chemistry and materials are challenging due to the complexity of correlated systems. A framework based on reconfigurable qubit architectures and digital–analogue simulations provides a hardware-efficient path forwards.

item.title: Floquet–Bloch manipulation of the Dirac gap in a topological antiferromagnet
item.description: Periodic laser light can modify the electronic properties of solids and offers a path to create new material phases. In a topological antiferromagnet, periodic driving with opposite light helicities is now shown to produce distinct Dirac mass gaps.

item.title: Liquid crystal torons in Poiseuille-like flows
item.description: No summary

item.title: Analysis of the defect mode features in an asymmetric and symmetric acoustic system using expansion chambers
item.description: No summary

item.title: Synthesis of pillar-layered metal–organic frameworks with variable backbones through sequence control
item.description: The tailoring of reticular materials is key for enhancing the complexity and diversity of their structure and function. Now, a series of isomeric pillar-layered metal–organic frameworks with tunable topologies have been prepared through altering the layer stacking, which enables variability on the backbone structure, pillar spatial arrangements and pore structure.

item.title: Explicit relation between thin film chromatography and column chromatography conditions from statistics and machine learning
item.description: The selection of experimental conditions for column chromatography is usually determined by experience. Here, authors have discovered explicit relation between thin layer chromatography and column chromatography through statistics and deep learning.

item.title: First-order phase transition of the Schwinger model with a quantum computer
item.description: No summary

item.title: High transmission in 120-degree sharp bends of inversion-symmetric and inversion-asymmetric photonic crystal waveguides
item.description: The study explores high transmission in 120-degree bends of photonic crystal waveguides. It reveals that high bend-transmission is primarily influenced by domain-wall configurations and is independent of inversion symmetry (valley-photonic effect).

item.title: Schlieren texture and topography induced confinement in an organic exciton-polariton laser
item.description: Organic exciton-polaritons represent an attractive platform for quantum devices. Here, authors show how introducing Schlieren texturing and a rough intra-cavity topography in a liquid crystalline polymer enables strong in-plane confinement of polaritons and drastically improved lasing.

item.title: Excavating trajectory planning of electric shovel based on dynamic excavating volume prediction
item.description: No summary

item.title: Database energy saving strategy using blockchain and Internet of Things
item.description: No summary

item.title: Error mitigation in brainbox quantum autoencoders
item.description: No summary

item.title: Spin transport properties in a topological insulator sandwiched between two-dimensional magnetic layers
item.description: No summary

item.title: Aggregation control of anionic pentamethine cyanine enabling excitation wavelength selective NIR-II fluorescence imaging-guided photodynamic therapy
item.description: Near-infrared-II fluorescence imaging-guided photodynamic therapy is hindered by the undesired aggregation of photosensitizers and the competition between fluorescence emission and reactive oxygen species generation. Here, the authors report an anionic pentamethine-based photosensitizer enabling excitation wavelength-selective fluorescence imaging-guided photodynamic therapy.

item.title: Coupling between topological edge state and defect mode-based biosensor using phononic crystal
item.description: No summary

item.title: Dipolar wavevector interference induces a polar skyrmion lattice in strained BiFeO3 films
item.description: In ultrathin BiFeO3 films on LaAlO3, compressive strain of the substrate induces a polar skyrmion lattice with nanometre periodicity.

item.title: A simplified computational liver perfusion model, with applications to organ preservation
item.description: No summary

item.title: Spontaneous curvature in two-dimensional van der Waals heterostructures
item.description: Lattice mismatch in 2D van der Waals heterostructures induces lattice reconstruction to optimize the stacking. Here, the authors show how this introduces curving of different heterobilayers from deep-learning-assisted molecular dynamics simulations.

item.title: Cold-atom quantum simulators of gauge theories
item.description: Large-scale quantum simulations of gauge theories are relevant to high-energy and condensed matter physics. This Review covers recent developments in simulating lattice gauge theories using cold atoms.

item.title: Observation of momentum-gap topology of light at temporal interfaces in a time-synthetic lattice
item.description: Here, the authors report the experimental observation of k-gap topology in a large-scale optical temporal synthetic lattice, manifesting as temporal topological boundary states.

item.title: Ferroelectricity with concomitant Coulomb screening in van der Waals heterostructures
item.description: Sliding ferroelectricity with finite conductance can yield ferroelectric hysteresis with concomitant Coulomb screening in monolayer graphene containing van der Waals heterostructures of various compositions.

item.title: Pressure treatment enables white-light emission in Zn-IPA MOF via asymmetrical metal-ligand chelate coordination
item.description: Pressure-treatment can alter the optical properties of metal-organic frameworks. Here the authors induce amorphization in Zn-IPA that remains after decompression and enables efficient white-light emission through narrowing the singlet-triplet gap.

item.title: Intervalence plasmons in boron-doped diamond
item.description: Doping diamond with boron is well known to change its electronic structure. Here, the authors reveal low-energy collective excitations in boron-doped diamond, which originate from intervalence band transitions.

item.title: Verdazyl radical polymers for advanced organic spintronics
item.description: While many semiconducting materials have been extensively explored for spintronic applications, issues regarding device performance, materials stability, and efficient spin current generation at room temperature persist. Here, the authors show that a nonconjugated radical polymer is an exceptional spin transport medium.

item.title: Revealing an unexpectedly low electron injection threshold via reinforced shock acceleration
item.description: The mechanisms resulting in particle acceleration to relativistic energies in space plasmas are an open question. Here, the authors show a reinforced shock acceleration model which enables electrons to efficiently achieve relativistic energies and reveal a low electron injection threshold.

item.title: Probabilistic nested model selection in pharmacokinetic analysis of DCE-MRI data in animal model of cerebral tumor
item.description: No summary

item.title: Confinement in a \({{\mathbb{Z}}}_{2}\) lattice gauge theory on a quantum computer
item.description: Gauge theories host important phenomena such as confinement that are difficult to study theoretically. Advances in quantum computers have now made it possible to perform digital quantum simulations of confinement dynamics in a gauge theory.

item.title: Investigating heavy quarkonia binding in an anisotropic-dense quark-gluon plasma with topological defects in the framework of fractional non-relativistic quark model
item.description: No summary

item.title: Resolving and routing magnetic polymorphs in a 2D layered antiferromagnet
item.description: The authors report on their observation of magnetic polymorphs in CrSBr using phase-sensitive second harmonic generation.

item.title: A kurtosis-ESPRIT algorithm for RealTime stability assessment in droop controlled microgrids
item.description: No summary

item.title: A novel voting measure for identifying influential nodes in complex networks based on local structure
item.description: No summary

item.title: Phase transitions, Dirac and Weyl semimetal states in Mn1−xGexBi2Te4
item.description: No summary

item.title: Quantitative analysis on the optical kerr impact and third harmonic generation in beltrami-shaped curved graphene
item.description: No summary

item.title: A python approach for prediction of physicochemical properties of anti-arrhythmia drugs using topological descriptors
item.description: No summary

item.title: Interaction-driven breakdown of Aharonov–Bohm caging in flat-band Rydberg lattices
item.description: The effect of strong interactions on the physics hosted by flat bands remains largely unexplored in atomic systems. An experiment in a synthetic flat-band lattice now demonstrates an interaction-driven transition from localization to delocalization.

item.title: Designer topological-single-atom catalysts with site-specific selectivity
item.description: Designing catalysts with uniform, site-specific selectivity and activity is a significant challenge. This study introduces design principles for topological-single-atom catalysts that utilize electronic shielding to protect surfaces and control reaction pathways, achieving high selectivity without compromising activity.

item.title: Vertex model with internal dissipation enables sustained flows
item.description: Complex tissue flows in epithelia arise from the coordination of mechanical forces, where cell shape anisotropy and nematic order play a significant role. By introducing internal viscous dissipation in an active nematic vertex model, this study explains the emergence of organised, long-range flows in epithelial sheets, linking cellular dynamics to continuum active nematic and collective cell migration.

item.title: Hyperedge overlap drives explosive transitions in systems with higher-order interactions
item.description: Group interactions can lead to explosive onsets of collective behaviors in biological and sociotechnological systems. Here, the authors show that it is the overlap between these kind of higher-order interactions that drives whether emergence of synchrony and epidemics shows up smoothly or abruptly.

item.title: Chiral exceptional point enhanced active tuning and nonreciprocity in micro-resonators
item.description: CMOS wafer scale manufactured chiral exceptional point non-Hermitian modulators were demonstrated through AIM photonics. This enables GHz-speed asymmetric electro-optic modulation with 17 dB contrast using CMOS-compatible voltages.

item.title: Research on health monitoring of concrete structure based on G-S-G
item.description: No summary

item.title: Excitons in the fractional quantum Hall effect
item.description: Excitonic pairing in fractional quantum Hall states shows two new quantum phases, including a fractional exciton condensate and an unusual type of exciton that obeys fermionic or anyonic quantum statistics.

item.title: Counterflow superfluidity in a two-component Mott insulator
item.description: Counterflow superfluidity is a quantum phase in which two fluid components flow in opposite directions without resistance, cancelling out their overall combined motion. This phase has now been observed in an optical lattice system hosting Bose mixtures.

item.title: Two-dimensional non-Hermitian skin effect in an ultracold Fermi gas
item.description: A two-dimensional non-Hermitian topological band is created in an ultracold system of fermions, which exhibits the non-Hermitian skin effect.

item.title: Particle exchange statistics beyond fermions and bosons
item.description: By developing a second quantization of paraparticles and constructing exactly solvable quantum spin models with emergent paraparticles, new theoretical evidence shows that non-trivial parastatistics inequivalent to either fermions or bosons can exist in physical systems.

item.title: Observing non-Hermiticity induced chirality breaking in a synthetic Hall ladder
item.description: The non-Hermiticity of gain/loss can break the chiral currents in a Hall ladder, resulting in antichiral currents where currents on both legs co-propagate in the same direction.

item.title: Spin polarization detection via chirality-induced tunnelling currents in indium selenide
item.description: Light chirality and electron spin interactions and the dependence of tunnelling photocurrent on the magnetic field are studied in indium selenide, exploiting its non-symmetric response to circularly polarized light to electrically detect chirality.

item.title: Computational microscopy with coherent diffractive imaging and ptychography
item.description: This review highlights transformative advancements in computational microscopy, encompassing coherent diffractive imaging and ptychography, which unify microscopy and crystallography to achieve unparalleled resolution, precision, and large fields of view, enabling diverse applications and driving breakthroughs across multidisciplinary sciences.

item.title: High resolution Brillouin spectroscopy of the surface acoustic waves in Sb2Te3 van der Waals single crystals
item.description: No summary

item.title: Thermal triggering for multi-state switching of polar topologies
item.description: Stable manipulation of polar skyrmions is challenging because of the underlying competitive energy scales. Now thermal excitation has been demonstrated to be an effective way to control such topological states.

item.title: How frictional ruptures and earthquakes nucleate and evolve
item.description: Experimental and theoretical evidence shows that incorporating finite interface widths extends fracture mechanics to include crack (and earthquake) nucleation; slow steady creep occurring at a well-defined stress threshold.

item.title: Dynamic supramolecular snub cubes
item.description: Left- and right-handed snub cubes show photocontrollable elasticity and hardness, in addition to the ability to encapsulate different small molecules in distinct compartments simultaneously, with potential applications in the development of advanced biomimetic materials.

item.title: Janus graphene nanoribbons with localized states on a single zigzag edge
item.description: Janus graphene nanoribbons with localized states on a single zigzag edge are fabricated by introducing a topological defect array of benzene motifs on the opposite zigzag edge, to break the structural symmetry.

item.title: The q-RASPR approach for predicting the property and fate of persistent organic pollutants
item.description: No summary

item.title: Synthesis of three-dimensional covalent organic frameworks through a symmetry reduction strategy
item.description: Three-dimensional covalent organic frameworks hold great potential for diverse applications, but their structural diversity is constrained by the synthetic approaches available. Now it is shown that ‘eight-connected’ building blocks with reduced symmetry enable the synthesis of such frameworks with rare topologies and enhanced gas adsorption performance.

item.title: Role of topological indices in predictive modeling and ranking of drugs treating eye disorders
item.description: No summary

item.title: Rapid quantitative analysis of double-stranded plasmid DNA with capillary gel electrophoresis for applications in quality control and radiation research
item.description: No summary

item.title: Observation of multiple steady states with engineered dissipation
item.description: No summary

item.title: Topological bands and correlated states in helical trilayer graphene
item.description: Trilayer graphene with the layers consecutively twisted by the same angle is shown to be a platform in which correlated and topological states exist, driven by local lattice relaxations.

item.title: A cutting-edge neural network approach for predicting the thermoelectric efficiency of defective gamma-graphyne nanoribbons
item.description: No summary

item.title: Taxonomy of high pressure vibration spectra of zincblende semiconductor alloys based on the percolation model
item.description: No summary

item.title: Nonlinear valley selection rules and all-optical probe of broken time-reversal symmetry in monolayer WSe2
item.description: The feasibility of using second-harmonic generation to measure the broken time-reversal symmetry and valley polarization in monolayer WSe2 is presented, simplifying the process of probing valleys on ultrafast timescales without perturbing the system.

item.title: Stable antivortices in multiferroic ε-Fe2O3 with the coalescence of misaligned grains
item.description: The creation of magnetic antivortices in two-dimensional magnets holds significant importance in spintronics. Here, the authors demonstrate the creation of stable antivortices in ε-Fe2O3 polycrystals by coalescing misaligned grains controllably.

item.title: Observation of quantum strong Mpemba effect
item.description: The Mpemba effect is an archetype for various anomalous relaxation phenomena. Here, the authors experimentally study a quantum version of the Mpemba effect in a single trapped ion system, where relaxation is exponentially accelerated by removing the excitation of the slowest decaying mode. This phenomenon, seen in Markovian open quantum systems containing Liouvillian exceptional points, indicates a link between the Mpemba effect and non-Hermitian physics.

item.title: Spin and valley dependent transport and tunneling magnetoresistance in irradiated ferromagnetic WSe2double barrier junctions
item.description: No summary

item.title: Roadmap on machine learning glassy dynamics
item.description: Slow heterogeneous dynamics and the absence of visible structural order make it difficult to numerically and theoretically investigate glass-forming materials. This Technical Review outlines the role that machine learning tools can have and identifies key challenges, possible approaches and appropriate benchmarks.

item.title: Neuromorphic weighted sums with magnetic skyrmions
item.description: Weighted sum operations can be performed in a compact, biologically inspired manner by using the non-volatile and particle-like characteristics of magnetic skyrmions that make them easily countable and summable.

item.title: Optimisation of the crystallisation process through staggered cooling in a nonvibrating granular system
item.description: No summary

item.title: Unifying spatiotemporal and frequential attention for traffic prediction
item.description: No summary

item.title: Assessment of the potential and application of Be12O12 nanocage for removal of ciprofloxacin from water employing density functional theory
item.description: No summary

item.title: Investigating Seidel energies and thermodynamic properties of benzenoid hydrocarbons through regression models
item.description: No summary

item.title: Unsupervised self-organising map classification of Raman spectra from prostate cell lines uncovers substratified prostate cancer disease states
item.description: No summary

item.title: Suppression of Bogoliubov momentum pairing and emergence of non-Gaussian correlations in ultracold interacting Bose gases
item.description: In strongly correlated systems, weak interactions can lead to the formation of correlated pairs of bosons with opposite momenta. Now, an experiment on ultracold bosons shows the breakdown of this effect in the strong interaction regime.

item.title: A magneto-thermoelectric with a high figure of merit in topological insulator Bi88Sb12
item.description: Applying a magnetic field to the topological material Bi88Sb12 enhances the Seebeck coefficient, resulting in a high thermoelectric figure of merit zT of 1.7 at 180 K and 0.7 T.

item.title: Effect of magnetized water on the fundamental grouting properties of cement grout under varying magnetization conditions
item.description: No summary

item.title: Deciphering antioxidant interactions via data mining and RDKit
item.description: No summary

item.title: Rényi relative entropy based monogamy of entanglement in tripartite systems
item.description: No summary

item.title: Entanglement microscopy and tomography in many-body systems
item.description: Quantum entanglement contains important information about quantum systems, but its calculation is challenging. Here the authors develop a quantum Monte Carlo technique for full tomography on microscopic subregions of a system, enabling extraction of multipartite quantum entanglement in large scale models.

item.title: Feshbach hypothesis of high-Tc superconductivity in cuprates
item.description: The microscopic pairing mechanism in high-temperature superconductors remains debated. Here, the authors offer a new perspective on this problem by proposing that the strong pairing in Fermi-Hubbard type models relevant to cuprates is driven by a Feshbach resonance, which enhances interactions between doped holes.

item.title: Multiphase superconductivity in PdBi2
item.description: β-PdBi2 superconducting properties have been known about since the 1950s, with various works since then indicating the possibility of multiple superconducting gaps and unconventional superconductivity. However, so far only a single gap s-wave superconductivity was detected. Here, using tunnelling spectroscopy under an applied magnetic field, Powell et al observe a transition from s-wave to nodal pairing.

item.title: Quantum memory at nonzero temperature in a thermodynamically trivial system
item.description: It has been commonly assumed that self-correcting quantum memories are only possible in systems with finite-temperature phase transitions to topological order. Here the authors show a complete breakdown of this expectation in quantum low-density parity-check codes.

item.title: The Nordic-walking mechanism and its explanation of deconfined pseudocriticality from Wess-Zumino-Witten theory
item.description: Deconfined quantum criticality represents a novel class of phase transitions that fall outside the Landau-Ginzburg theory, but experiments on material candidates show a weakly-first order transition. Here the authors introduce a Nordic walking mechanism to explain this behavior.

item.title: Observation of 1/3 fractional quantum Hall physics in balanced large angle twisted bilayer graphene
item.description: This study explores fractional quantum Hall physics in large-angle twisted bilayer graphene, revealing a 1/3 fractional quantum Hall state driven by strong interlayer Coulomb interactions. Monte Carlo simulations confirm unique topological ground states and transitions with applied displacement fields.

item.title: Room-temperature creation and conversion of individual skyrmion bags in magnetic multilayered disks
item.description: Experimental investigation on skyrmion bags focuses on single-phase materials. Here, the authors demonstrate room-temperature creation, conversion and zero-field stability of individual skyrmion bags in magnetic multilayered disks.

item.title: Spectroscopic, quantum chemical, and topological calculations of the phenylephrine molecule using density functional theory
item.description: No summary

item.title: Self-induced optical non-reciprocity
item.description: No summary

item.title: Spectral optimization of supercontinuum shaping using metaheuristic algorithms, a comparative study
item.description: No summary

item.title: Creation of a stable vector vortex beam with dual fractional orbital angular momentum
item.description: No summary

item.title: Hetero-integrated perovskite/Si3N4 on-chip photonic system
item.description: Hybrid hetero-integration of dual-functional perovskite diodes and a photonic neural network for computing tasks are demonstrated on a near-infrared monolithic on-chip photonic system based on a perovskite/silicon nitride platform, exemplifying the extension of perovskite device applications.

item.title: Silicon photonic MEMS switches based on split waveguide crossings
item.description: This work proposes a unique mechanism of manipulating the mode propagation for photonic switching with a brand-new split waveguide crossing, demonstrating great potential for the applications in a wide spectrum of scenarios.

item.title: Momentum tunnelling between nanoscale liquid flows
item.description: A liquid flow can cross a solid wall, at odds with classical hydrodynamics, thanks to couplings between the liquid’s fluctuations and the electronic excitations of the solid inducing a momentum tunnelling.

item.title: Exploring the structure and properties of \(\alpha\)-sheet based bilayer borophenes
item.description: No summary

item.title: Distorting crack-front geometry for enhanced toughness by manipulating bioinspired heterogeneity
item.description: To understand and control the toughening by tortuous cracks in heterogeneous materials, a distorted crack-front geometric toughening mechanism is presented here by manipulating bioinspired heterogeneity.

item.title: Investigating skyrmion stability and core polarity reversal in NdMn2Ge2
item.description: No summary

item.title: Engineering ultra-strong electron-phonon coupling and nonclassical electron transport in crystalline gold with nanoscale interfaces
item.description: The electron-phonon interaction in gold and silver is weak, which leads to both their high conductivity and lack of conventional superconductivity. Here, Kumbhakar and coauthors find, using point contact spectroscopy, that the electron-phonon interaction in a nanostructured gold-silver film can be enhanced by over two orders of magnitude compared to the constituent elements.

item.title: Multipocket synergy towards high thermoelectric performance in topological semimetal TaAs2
item.description: The electron-hole compensation hinders the magneto-Seebeck coefficient of topological semimetals. Here, authors report simultaneous high longitudinal and transverse thermopowers in a TaAs2 single crystal by a multipocket synergy strategy.

item.title: Experimental identification of topological defects in 2D colloidal glass
item.description: Recent numerical simulations indicate that well-defined topological defects arise in the dynamics of glasses. Here, the authors report the presence of topological defects in the vibrational eigenspace of an experimental two-dimensional colloidal glass.

item.title: Unusual violation of the Wiedemann–Franz law at ultralow temperatures in topological compensated semimetals
item.description: This work reveals an unusual T4 temperature dependence of the electronic thermal conductivity at ultralow temperatures and a strong violation of the Wiedemann-Franz law in the topological compensated semimetals TaAs2, NbAs2, and NdSb.

item.title: Optimal design of tilt integral derivative controller for a boost converter based on swarm-inspired algorithms
item.description: No summary

item.title: Quantum machine learning for Lyapunov-stabilized computation offloading in next-generation MEC networks
item.description: No summary

item.title: Predicting noncoding RNA and disease associations using multigraph contrastive learning
item.description: No summary

item.title: Computational insights into spin-polarized density functional theory applied to actinide-based perovskites XBkO₃ (X = Sr, Ra, Pb)
item.description: No summary

item.title: 2.5-dimensional covalent organic frameworks
item.description: Covalent organic frameworks (COFs) have wide applications but are difficult to enhance crystallinity. Here, the authors show COFs with 2.5-dimensional skeletons. The COFs attain planar shapes useful for applications, large crystal sizes of above 0.1 mm, and better CO2 separation properties over previous organic porous materials.

item.title: Magnetochiral charge pumping due to charge trapping and skin effect in chirality-induced spin selectivity
item.description: Some chiral molecules can produce a giant spin polarization, a feature termed chirality-induced spin selectivity. The origin of this has been hotly debated. In this theory work, Zhao, Zhang and coauthors propose that the origin of the effect lies in charge trapping induced barrier modification, termed magnetochiral charge pumping.

item.title: Artificial molecular communication network based on DNA nanostructures recognition
item.description: Artificial simulated communication networks use biological and chemical molecules as information carriers to realize information transmission, but their design is challenging. Here, the authors report a DNA nanostructure recognition-based artificial molecular communication network, in which rectangular DNA origami nanostructures serve as nodes and their recognition as edges, and use it to construct various communication network topologies.

item.title: Endowing single-crystal polymers with circularly polarized luminescence
item.description: Single-crystal polymers with circularly polarized luminescence are interesting materials, but challenging to prepare. Here, the authors report a single-crystal-to-single-crystal topochemical photopolymerisation to form polyionic polymer crystals with circularly polarized luminescence.

item.title: Reversible multivalent carrier redox exceeding intercalation capacity boundary
item.description: Aqueous batteries with multivalent-ion storage chemistry offer higher theoretical capacity than monovalent-ion. Here, authors report divalent copper intercalation into vanadium disulfide with additional copper redox that provides higher capacity than intercalation transition metal redox alone.

item.title: An aperiodic chiral tiling by topological molecular self-assembly
item.description: Aperiodic tessellation is an important concept not only in art and mathematics, but also in materials science. Here the authors report on aperiodic tiling through two-dimensional molecular self-assembly on a surface involving dynamic chirality.

item.title: Portable astronomical observation system based on large-aperture concentric-ring metalens
item.description: No summary

item.title: Non-Abelian lattice gauge fields in photonic synthetic frequency dimensions
item.description: Non-Abelian lattice gauge fields in photonic synthetic frequency dimensions can be used to study lattice physics in a scalable and programmable way.

item.title: Metrology with a twist: probing and sensing with vortex light
item.description: AI algorithms analyzes the OAM spectrum and intensity patterns of twisted light as it propagates through a turbulent medium, enabling the detection of the key features of the medium.

item.title: Enhanced sensitivity via non-Hermitian topology
item.description: No summary

item.title: Role of homeostatic plasticity in critical brain dynamics following focal stroke lesions
item.description: No summary

item.title: Small-angle scattering interferometry with neutron orbital angular momentum states
item.description: Introduction of structured neutron waves carrying orbital angular momentum (OAM) in small-angle neutron scattering experiments provides novel approaches to the characterisation of material properties. Here the authors demonstrate the retrieval of phase information in far-field intensity profiles by means of an interferometric technique using helical neutron waves.

item.title: Regressions on quantum neural networks at maximal expressivity
item.description: No summary

item.title: Surface reconstruction limited magnetism of the nodal loop semimetal Ca\(_3\)P\(_2\)
item.description: No summary

item.title: Quantum quench dynamics of geometrically frustrated Ising models
item.description: Quantum annealers have been used to study equilibrium states of condensed matter models and recently extended to 1D quantum quench dynamics. Here the authors use a quantum annealer to study the quench dynamics of 2D quantum spin models that are hard to simulate classically.

item.title: Dynamic control of 2D non-Hermitian photonic corner skin modes in synthetic dimensions
item.description: Dynamic control of light flow in 2D synthetic landscapes is emerging as a valuable tool for the development of light-based technologies. Here the authors harness time-dependent non-Hermitian Hamiltonians to demonstrate dynamic control over the skin effect.

item.title: Observation of non-Hermitian boundary induced hybrid skin-topological effect excited by synthetic complex frequencies
item.description: Hybrid skin-topological effect (HSTE) is a new phenomenon involving the interplay between non-Hermitian skin effects and topological edge states. Here, the authors highlight the key role of boundary configurations and experimentally observe HSTE states using synthetic complex frequencies.

item.title: Electronic ferroelectricity in monolayer graphene moiré superlattices
item.description: Monolayer graphene, with its highly centrosymmetric hexagonal lattice, is typically not considered ferroelectric. Here, the authors observe ferroelectricity in monolayer graphene by introducing asymmetric moiré superlattices, where polarization arises from electron-hole dipoles.

item.title: Clustering Cu-S based compounds using periodic table representation and compositional Wasserstein distance
item.description: No summary

item.title: Distinguishing local isomorphism classes in quasicrystals by high-order harmonic spectroscopy
item.description: Quasicrystals (QCs) belonging to different local isomorphism classes (LICs) are notoriously challenging to distinguish with electron diffraction. Here the authors demonstrate that high-order harmonics generated from vertical illumination by a laser beam can efficiently provide such distinction, paving the way to all-optical characterizations of QCs and disorder in solids.

item.title: Orientation-selective spin-polarized edge states in monolayer NiI2
item.description: Spin-polarized edge states in two-dimensional materials hold promise for spintronics and quantum computing applications. Here, the authors reveal the orientation-selective spin-polarized edge states along the Ni-terminated edges in monolayer NiI2 islands.

item.title: Atomically engineering interlayer symmetry operations of two-dimensional crystals
item.description: van der Waals (vdW) materials offer unique opportunities to engineer their crystal symmetry, but usually require top-down fabrication approaches. Here, the authors report a mica substrate-guided bottom-up method to grow exotic phases of SnSe2 and other vdW materials, showing tunable nonlinear optical properties.

item.title: Polar vortex hidden in twisted bilayers of paraelectric SrTiO3
item.description: The authors find polar vortex arrays in twisted paraelectric SrTiO3. By employing multislice electron ptychography, the atomic structures of different layers are effectively resolved, allowing for the identification of depth-dependent rotation reversal of the in-plane polarization.

item.title: Robust ferromagnetism in wafer-scale Fe3GaTe2 above room-temperature
item.description: While the list of van der Waals magnetic materials has expanded considerably over the last few years, these are still typically limited to low temperatures. Here, Wu et al report wafer scale growth, and robust room temperature ferromagnetism in Fe3GaTe2.

item.title: A machine learning based classifier for topological quantum materials
item.description: No summary

item.title: A density-based MS disease diagnosis model using the capuchin search algorithm and an ensemble of deep neural networks
item.description: No summary

item.title: Design of integrated radar and communication system based on solvable chaotic signal
item.description: No summary

item.title: A two-level resolution neural network with enhanced interpretability for freeway traffic forecasting
item.description: No summary

item.title: Engineered crystalline polymers for effective contaminant removal from water
item.description: No summary

item.title: Recycling e-waste into gold-loaded covalent organic framework catalysts for terminal alkyne carboxylation
item.description: The rising demand for gold requires innovative methods for its recovery from e-waste. Here, the authors describe tetrazine-linked covalent organic frameworks loaded with recovered gold from mixed metal e-waste which serve as efficient, reusable catalysts for CO2 carboxylation of alkynes.

item.title: Topological transformation of microbial proteins into iron single-atom sites for selective hydrogen peroxide electrosynthesis
item.description: Single-atom catalysts hold great potential for the electrochemical oxygen reduction reaction in hydrogen peroxide production. Here, the authors report Fe single-atom catalysts derived from microbial protein precursors, which enhance both the selectivity and activity for hydrogen peroxide production.
